parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Difficulty

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> '''Prior to <template><title>arma3</title></template>''' it returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode.

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> <template><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command returns the status of the global [[Arma 3: Difficulty Settings| difficulty]] <tt>showCadetHints</tt>.<br>Use <tt>[[difficulty]] [[in]] [0,1]</tt> to achieve the '''original intended''' functionality!</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cadetMode'''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] - true when playing in cadet mode, false when playing in veteran mode
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>? ([[cadetMode]]) : _AIsoldier [[setSkill]] 0.1 //sqs</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[cadetMode]]) [[then]] {_AIsoldier [[setSkill]] 0.1}; //sqf</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[hintCadet]], [[difficulty]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on December 1, 2009 - 17:49</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killswitch|Killswitch]]<dd class="note">
In ArmA II, this command will return true if the difficulty level is set to "Recruit" or "Regular". It returns false for the "Veteran" and "Expert" difficulty levels.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
